threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature fires on the presence of Base64 encoded URI prefixes (http:// and https://) across any file. The simple presence of such strings is not inherently an indicator of malicious content, but is worth further investigation.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects indicators often found in linux malware samples. Note: This detection is based on common characteristics typically associated with the mentioned threats, must be considered a clue and does not conclusively prove maliciousness.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects code found in report on exploits against CVE-2020-5902 F5 BIG-IP vulnerability by NCC group
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects attempts to force stop the ufw using ufw-init
Detect use of iptables to flush all firewall rules, tables and chains and allow all network traffic
Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: (stream_tcp) data sent on stream after TCP reset sent
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:129; sid:8; rev:2; msg:"(stream_tcp) data sent on stream after TCP reset sent"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type preproc; classtype:protocol-command-decode;)
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Destination Unreachable Host Unreachable"; icode:1; itype:3; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:399; rev:9; )

attributes.magic: Bourne-Again shell script, ASCII text executable, with very long lines (362u)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
This script initiates by disabling SELinux, increasing the file descriptor limit, and completely disabling the system firewall by flushing iptables rules and setting all default policies to ACCEPT. It configures the kernel's huge pages memory allocation and disables the NMI watchdog. It then proceeds to terminate a wide array of processes associated with common cryptocurrency miners, specific network ports, IP addresses, and keywords like 'tmate', 'kinsing', 'xmr', and 'c3pool', as well as processes running from `/tmp`.

The script attempts to disable or uninstall cloud security agents from Alibaba Cloud (`aliyun-service`, `aegis`) and Tencent Cloud (`yunjing`, `stargate`, `barad_agent`), including removing their files, services, and adding specific iptables drop rules for their IP ranges. It appends Google's public DNS server (8.8.8.8) to `/etc/resolv.conf` if not already present.

It then selects an available download utility (curl or wget) and establishes persistence by creating multiple cron jobs that download and execute a script named `xmss` from `http://89.125.152.38`. These cron jobs are set up for root and other users, and are placed in various locations including user crontabs, `/etc/cron.d`, and `/etc/cron.hourly`. It also executes a remote script `1.sh` from `http://89.125.152.38`.

The script attempts lateral movement by enumerating SSH keys, usernames, and host information from local configuration files and history. It then attempts to SSH into discovered hosts using these credentials and, upon success, downloads and executes the `xmss` script from `http://dm.pminer.top`.

Finally, the script performs extensive cleanup by clearing system logs, SSH authorized keys, bash history, and removing numerous files and directories typically associated with other malware or temporary execution. It also identifies and terminates Docker containers and removes Docker images matching keywords related to cryptocurrency mining.
